channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: Countries Pledge To Recover Dwindling Pacific Bluefin Tuna Population
item.description: September 1, 2017 - The long-term agreement would aid fish stocks that have fallen to just 2.6 percent of their historic size. The news comes at a time when Atlantic bluefin populations are also rebounding.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - The long-term agreement would aid fish stocks that have fallen to just 2.6 percent of their historic size. The news comes at a time when Atlantic bluefin populations are also rebounding. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/01/547903557/countries-pledge-to-recover-dwindling-pacific-bluefin-tuna-population

item.title: Texas Expedites Help From Out-Of-State Health Care Providers
item.description: September 1, 2017 - As the medical and mental health needs of people affected by Harvey become apparent, Texas has made it easier for out-of-state health workers to come lend a hand.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - As the medical and mental health needs of people affected by Harvey become apparent, Texas has made it easier for out-of-state health workers to come lend a hand. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/01/547816150/texas-expedites-help-from-out-of-state-health-care-providers

item.title: The Divisive Diet of Honeybees: Why Some Will Never Be Royals
item.description: September 1, 2017 - That stings! A new study suggests that fragments of plant genetic material in the pollen-rich diets of worker bee larvae ensures that they never grow up to be queens.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - That stings! A new study suggests that fragments of plant genetic material in the pollen-rich diets of worker bee larvae ensures that they never grow up to be queens. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/01/547601291/the-divisive-diet-of-honeybees-why-some-will-never-be-royals

item.title: The LSU Tigers' New Tiger Makes His Debut
item.description:
September 1, 2017 - Louisiana State University's live tiger mascot is an institution. Recently, the school got a new tiger — just in time for football season.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/09/01/547270000/the-lsu-tigers-new-tiger-makes-his-debut
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Coral Reef Fish Are More Resilient Than We Thought, Study Finds
item.description: August 31, 2017 - Ocean acidification can cause reckless behavior in coral reef fish. But researchers say that coral reef environments have large chemical variations daily, which can offer recovery time for fish.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - Ocean acidification can cause reckless behavior in coral reef fish. But researchers say that coral reef environments have large chemical variations daily, which can offer recovery time for fish. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/31/547606153/coral-reef-fish-are-more-resilient-than-we-thought-study-finds

item.title: Chemical Plant Fire Raises Environmental Concerns In Wake Of Harvey
item.description:
August 31, 2017 - A fire at a chemical plant near Houston has raised concerns about the environmental consequences of the storm.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/31/547646702/chemical-plant-fire-raises-environmental-concerns-in-wake-of-harvey
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: What To Do When Facing A Floating Ball Of Fire Ants
item.description: August 31, 2017 - "Avoid, avoid, avoid," one fire ant expert says. The ants, common in areas flooded by Harvey, can't be submerged underwater. But if you have a bottle of soapy water, you might be able to drown them.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - "Avoid, avoid, avoid," one fire ant expert says. The ants, common in areas flooded by Harvey, can't be submerged underwater. But if you have a bottle of soapy water, you might be able to drown them. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/31/547541719/what-to-do-when-facing-a-floating-ball-of-fire-ants

item.title: Ants, Seaweed, Chocolate Beer And (Maybe) Less Meat: The Future Of Food
item.description: August 31, 2017 - When it comes to finding and preparing food, we're a continually inventive species. Anthropologist Barbara J. King asks: What are the food trends of the future?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - When it comes to finding and preparing food, we're a continually inventive species. Anthropologist Barbara J. King asks: What are the food trends of the future? http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/31/547550216/ants-seaweed-chocolate-beer-and-maybe-less-meat-the-future-of-food

item.title: From Hawk To Horse: Animal Rescues During Hurricane Harvey
item.description: August 31, 2017 - A storm of this magnitude affects many animals. Uplifting videos show people rescuing all kinds of animals from Hurricane Harvey's floodwaters, says anthropologist Barbara J. King.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - A storm of this magnitude affects many animals. Uplifting videos show people rescuing all kinds of animals from Hurricane Harvey's floodwaters, says anthropologist Barbara J. King. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/31/547332452/from-hawk-to-horse-animal-rescues-during-hurricane-harvey

item.title: Riding With A Rescue Mission In The Surreal, Perilous Texas Floods
item.description: August 30, 2017 - Nearly a week since Harvey struck Houston, many people remain stranded by high water in their neighborhoods. NPR rode along on a citizen water-borne rescue operation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - Nearly a week since Harvey struck Houston, many people remain stranded by high water in their neighborhoods. NPR rode along on a citizen water-borne rescue operation. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/30/547347581/riding-with-a-rescue-mission-in-the-surreal-perilous-texas-floods

item.title: Researchers Explore New Methods To Quantify Power Of Storms After Harvey
item.description: August 30, 2017 - As Harvey continues to dump damaging rain on the south, some researchers are looking at new ways to quantify the power of a big storm.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - As Harvey continues to dump damaging rain on the south, some researchers are looking at new ways to quantify the power of a big storm. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/30/547373292/researchers-explore-new-methods-to-quantify-power-of-storms-after-harvey

item.title: Whatever Happened To ... Those Farmers Who Needed Shoes?
item.description: August 30, 2017 - It was a mystery: How did farmers in Uganda contract a nightmare illness? A researcher found the answer. What's the best way to help them?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - It was a mystery: How did farmers in Uganda contract a nightmare illness? A researcher found the answer. What's the best way to help them? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/30/547051705/whatever-happened-to-those-farmers-who-needed-shoes

item.title: Why The Toxin Trouble With Tiny Turtles Continues
item.description: August 30, 2017 - The government is warning people not to handle tiny turtles because of the risk of contracting salmonella. The problem is, it has been warning us for 40 years and we're still getting sick.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - The government is warning people not to handle tiny turtles because of the risk of contracting salmonella. The problem is, it has been warning us for 40 years and we're still getting sick. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547305528/why-the-toxin-trouble-with-tiny-turtles-continues

item.title: When Nature Teaches Us How To Be Human
item.description: August 30, 2017 - As global warming changes the planet, we will experience many severe weather events. How we fare will depend largely on how well we preserve our best qualities — and community, says Marcelo Gleiser.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - As global warming changes the planet, we will experience many severe weather events. How we fare will depend largely on how well we preserve our best qualities — and community, says Marcelo Gleiser. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/30/547322858/when-nature-teaches-us-how-to-be-human

item.title: Houston's Susceptibility To Flooding
item.description: August 30, 2017 - Sam Brody, a professor at Texas A&M at Galveston, talks with Ailsa Chang about how Houston area levees, reservoirs, dams and bayous have been holding up during the storm.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
